title: The Purge of Algorithms
outcome: The Directorate acts unilaterally, purging all BCI code linked to Halden. Systems revert to pre-BCI rules. Some citizens benefit, others are locked out, and services stutter. The abrupt shift restores order but ignites new uncertainty and resentment.

events.description: Directorate teams enter Stenograd's data hubs and begin purging Halden-authored BCI code. Warnings about potential service impact are sent to Council factions.
Residents experience sudden loss and restoration of vital services, as core BCI functions revert. Some regain access to essential benefits, while others are unexpectedly locked out.
Disoriented citizens rally in major districts, demanding explanation and stability. Provisional guidelines are published warning that services will remain patchy as old systems are restored.
Harmonists and Innovators clash in Council meetings—one side fearing loss of control, the other pushing to salvage BCI remnants for a new system.
Temporary order returns under Directorate protocols, but resentment builds among those now excluded. Calls for an entirely new model of governance intensify across the city.
